text: Georgios "George" Tsiakos (alternate spelling: Giorgos) (Greek: Γιώργος Τσιάκος; born July 19, 1982) is a Greek professional basketball player. He is a 2.06 m (6 ft 9 in) tall power forward-center. ==Professional career== Tsiakos won the Greek 2nd Division championship in 2014, with AEK Athens. ==National team career== Tsiakos was a member of the junior national teams of Greece. With Greece's junior national team, he played at the 2002 FIBA Europe Under-20 Championship, where he won a gold medal. With Greece's under-26 national team, he won the silver medal at the 2005 Mediterranean Games.Georgios TSIAKOS (GRE). ==References== ==External links== *Official Facebook Profile *FIBA Profile *FIBA Europe Profile *RealGM.com Profile *Eurobasket.com Profile Category:1982 births Category:Living people Category:AEK B.C. players Category:AEL 1964 BC players Category:BK Ventspils players Category:Dafni B.C. players Category:CB Inca players Category:Centers (basketball) Category:Competitors at the 2005 Mediterranean Games Category:Greek men's basketball players Category:Holargos B.C. players Category:Ilysiakos B.C. players Category:Kavala B.C. players Category:Kolossos Rodou B.C. players Category:Koroivos B.C. players Category:Maroussi B.C. players Category:Mediterranean Games medalists in basketball Category:Mediterranean Games silver medalists for Greece Category:Near East B.C. players Category:Panelefsiniakos B.C. players Category:Panionios B.C. players Category:PAOK B.C. players Category:Peristeri B.C. players Category:Power forwards (basketball)
